Package org.cdmckay.coffeedom.input

Classes to build CoffeeDOM documents from various sources.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
BuilderErrorHandler The standard CoffeeDOM error handler implementation.
DOMBuilder Builds a CoffeeDOM Document from a pre-existing DOM org.w3c.dom.Document.
SAXBuilder Builds a CoffeeDOM document from files, streams, readers, URLs, or a SAX InputSource instance using a SAX parser.
SAXHandler A support class for SAXBuilder.
 

Exception Summary
CoffeeDOMParseException Thrown during parse errors, with information about where the parse error occurred as well as access to the partially built document.
 

Package org.cdmckay.coffeedom.input Description

Classes to build CoffeeDOM documents from various sources. The most common builder class is SAXBuilder which constructs a CoffeeDOM document using a SAX parser and can pull content from files, streams, sockets, readers, and so on. It can use any underlying SAX parser to handle the parsing chores. SAXHandler provides support for SAXBuilder. DOMBuilder lets you build from a pre-existing DOM tree.
